daily_summary.headline: Blue Origin's Crewed Suborbital Flight Highlights the Day

top_events.title: New Shepard NS-38 Crewed Suborbital Launch
top_events.description: Blue Origin launches its 17th crewed New Shepard flight, carrying six private astronauts on a suborbital journey.
top_events.action: Watch the livestream or follow updates for this crewed space tourism mission.

top_events.title: Rocket Lab Electron Launches Open Cosmos Constellation
top_events.description: Rocket Lab's Electron launches the first two satellites for Open Cosmos' secure LEO broadband constellation, supporting European connectivity.
top_events.action: Tune in to Rocket Lab's webcast for this commercial satellite deployment.

top_events.title: Minor Aurora Opportunity (G1) at High Latitudes
top_events.description: A minor geomagnetic storm (Kp 4.67, G1) may provide aurora visibility for observers above 65° latitude.
top_events.action: Check northern skies if you are at high latitudes; low probability for Central Europe.

alerts.title: Blue Origin New Shepard NS-38 Crewed Launch
alerts.message: Blue Origin is launching its 17th crewed New Shepard flight with six private astronauts. Significant for commercial space tourism.
alerts.action_required: Watch the livestream or follow updates for real-time coverage.

opportunities.recommendation: Possible aurora at high latitudes. Best for observers above 65°. Worth checking if conditions are optimal.
